title: Trust in God Alone
shortSummary: Psalm 62 is a heartfelt declaration of unwavering trust in God as the sole source of salvation, strength, and refuge. David contrasts the fleeting nature of human power and wealth with the eternal security found only in God, urging believers to pour out their hearts before Him and rely solely on His mercy and justice.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this psalm, King of Israel, expressing his deep trust in God amidst adversity.

keyCharacters.name: Jeduthun
keyCharacters.description: A chief musician or worship leader to whom this psalm is directed for musical performance.

keyCharacters.name: Enemies/Adversaries
keyCharacters.description: Those who plot mischief and deceit against David, representing opposition to God's anointed.

definitions.definition: A metaphor for God’s strength, stability, and protection, emphasizing His unchanging nature.
A musical or liturgical pause in the psalm, inviting reflection on the preceding words.
Futility or emptiness; here it refers to the worthlessness of trusting in human status or wealth.

outline.heading: Declaration of Trust in God
outline.description: David opens by affirming his soul’s patient waiting on God, recognizing Him as his rock, salvation, and defense, which keeps him unshaken.

outline.heading: Condemnation of Enemies’ Schemes
outline.description: David confronts the malicious plans of his enemies, describing their deceitful nature and ultimate downfall.

outline.heading: Renewed Call to Trust and Wait on God
outline.description: Reiterating his confidence, David exhorts his soul and all people to trust God alone, pouring out their hearts to Him as a refuge.

outline.heading: The Futility of Trusting in People and Riches
outline.description: David warns against placing confidence in social status, oppression, or wealth, highlighting their ultimate emptiness.

outline.heading: God’s Sovereign Power and Justice
outline.description: The psalm concludes with the affirmation that power belongs to God alone, who mercifully rewards each according to their deeds.

application: Place your full trust in God as your unshakable rock and refuge, especially in times of trouble or uncertainty.
Avoid relying on wealth, social status, or human strength, recognizing their temporary and unreliable nature.
Regularly pour out your heart to God in prayer, seeking His presence and protection as a refuge.
Remember that God’s justice is perfect and that He will reward each person according to their works, encouraging faithful obedience.

keyVerses.text: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the exclusive and steadfast security found in God alone.

keyVerses.text: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful call to continual trust and honest prayer, affirming God as our refuge.

keyVerses.text: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes God’s sovereign authority over all power and circumstances.

keyVerses.text: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
keyVerses.significance: It reminds believers of God’s mercy and just judgment, encouraging righteous living.
